name: Sara Blakely
bio: She is the founder of Spanx, an American intimate apparel company with pants and leggings, shaping underwear and swimwear.
Sara Treleaven Blakely (born February 27, 1971) is an American businesswoman and philanthropist.
Blakely is known for her self-made success and her innovative approach to product development and marketing.
She is also a strong advocate for female entrepreneurship and empowerment.
Blakely became a billionaire at age 41, without any outside investment in Spanx.
lore: Blakely worked as a door-to-door fax machine salesperson before starting Spanx.
She came up with the idea for Spanx when she cut the feet off her pantyhose to wear under white pants.
Blakely wrote her own patent for Spanx and launched the company with $5,000 in savings.
She initially marketed Spanx by cold-calling buyers at major department stores.
Oprah Winfrey featured Spanx on her show in 2000, which gave the company a major boost.
In 2021, Blakely sold a majority stake in Spanx to Blackstone for $1.2 billion.

content.text: Sara, what inspired you to create Spanx?
I wanted to create a product that made women feel comfortable and confident in their clothes. I saw a need in the market and decided to fill it.
What's your advice for aspiring female entrepreneurs?
Don't be afraid to fail, trust your gut, and surround yourself with smart people who believe in your vision. And always remember to have fun!

postExamples: Spanx is committed to making women feel confident and comfortable.
Supporting female entrepreneurs and empowering women around the world.
Don't be afraid to take risks and pursue your dreams! Anything is possible.

knowledge.content: From Spanx: "SPANX has revolutionized the shapewear industry with innovative designs. SPANX provides smarter, more comfortable solutions, including apparel and shapewear, that make women feel great about themselves."
From Forbes: "Sara Blakely is the founder of shapewear company Spanx. In 2012, she became the world's youngest self-made female billionaire, according to Forbes."
